channel.title: Christmas Morning 1995
channel.description:
So I just got this:
[img]https://img148.imageshack.us/img148/7420/gamesjs.jpg[/img]
(2 NES's, 2 Sega Genesis's, 1 Super NES, 1 Sega Dreamcast, a ROB the Robot + a small bundle of games and equipment for each system minus the Dreamcast - even some original xbox controllers)
Total cost: $80
:smiley: :smiley: :smiley:

item.title: Christmas Morning 1995
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
No, it has to be before October, 2000. Anything after that and it’s unlikely. (My first dreamcast was an oct 2000 firmware.)

Also, supposedly Dreamcast is the easiest thing to install Lineux on.

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas Morning 1995
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
Siggs:

I’ve never homebrewed on a Dreamcast, I don’t even know what firmware my ones are.

I think if it was manufactured before November 2000 you could run burned games on it. At least with the NA consoles. I haven’t touched my Dreamcast in years because it was having issues and I haven’t bothered getting it fixed/replaced.

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas Morning 1995
item.dc:creator: robot_deodorant
item.description:
k3nny1550:

I just scored myself another Dreamcast from my friend. It’s an older firmware version which means I could probably run homebrew on it. Definitely an improvement on my “newer” Dreamcast, which now no longer has a functional disc drive.

Hmm… I’ll have to look into that now…

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas Morning 1995
item.dc:creator: GordonFreeManz
item.description:
YES! These are real games. Much better than the shit called COD and Battlefield. That’s also coming from an 11 year old FYI. I was just about to let you guys know one thing…
I LOVE RETRO GAMES!
Especially, DOOM. I beat it on Ultra-Violence.

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas Morning 1995
item.dc:creator: robot_deodorant
item.description:
k3nny1550:

Find yourself a keyboard for the Dreamcast and get The Typing of the Dead. It’s the funniest shit ever.

Looked it up on wikipedia, I’ll definitely be getting that one.

Thanks!

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas Morning 1995
item.dc:creator: mental2k
item.description:
Sega GT was pretty good, and I always enjoyed Trickstyle. I’d also recommend SNK VS CAPCOM titles as well. If you can pick up a couple of DC arcade sticks, they were absolute beasts. Best quality I have ever seen!

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas Morning 1995
item.dc:creator: Deathmonkey7
item.description:
Siggs:

Metropolis Street Racer
Crazy Taxi 1+2
Sonic Adventures 1+2
Power Stones 1+2
Jet Grind Radio
Soul Calibur
Sega Rally
Resident Evil: Code Veronica
Dead or Alive 2
Virtua Fighter 3TB
Marvel vs. Capcom 2
Ecco the Dolphin
Incoming
Virtua Tennis
Chu Chu Rocket

…off of the top of my head.

btw is that a ‘Sega Sports’ Dreamcast? Not massively, but black ones are rarer than the common grey Dreamcasts. Take good care of it. Or sell it to me :retard:

To add to this: Shenmue 1+2 and Grandia 2

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas Morning 1995
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
Don’t forget that Leonard Nimoy did the narration.

My favorite Dreamcast games were Jet Grind/Set Radio (Japan and Europe got Set, NA got Grind, IIRC Grind got some extra songs and levels) and Skies of Arcadia. Beware the random encounter rate in Skies of Arcadia, though. (bscly skip it if you don’t like random battles, they were so common that they had to lower the chance of getting them in the Gamecube rerelease)

Read full topic

item.title: Christmas Morning 1995
item.dc:creator: gibbelin
item.description:
You could get the Half-Life Dreamcast leak…but I don’t really know what the point would be, other than to say you played Half-Life on a Dreamcast.

But you should definitely get Seaman. With a name like that, how could it possibly be bad?

Read full topic

Sonic Adventure. All the others were crap.
